snippet: During the height of the Ebola outbreak, a community signed over large swaths of farming land. Now, some are questioning the benefits, and ethics, of the deal.
abstract: Several communities in southeastern Liberia have handed over large swaths of farmland to palm oil company Golden Veroleum Liberia during Ebola outbreak, in return for promises of employment and infrastructure; advocacy groups say company took advantage of desperation stemming from outbreak to pressure residents into bad land deal.
lead_paragraph: During the height of the Ebola outbreak, a community signed over large swaths of farming land. Now, some are questioning the benefits, and ethics, of the deal.

headline.main: Palm Oil Company Is Accused of Exploiting Liberia’s Ebola Crisis
headline.print_headline: Palm Oil Company Is Accused of Exploiting Liberia’s Ebola Crisis
